V Novi Gorici premierno predstavili dokumentarni portret o Jožetu Šušmelju
04 Nov 2019, 18:50 by STA

V Novi Gorici so danes predstavili dokumentarni filmski portret o Jožetu Šušmelju. V Voglarjih na Trnovski planoti rojeni sociolog, politik in diplomat je v svoji bogati karieri opravljal številne pomembne naloge tako za slovenski kot tudi zamejski prostor in v njem pustil neizbrisen pečat. Dokumentarni film so pripravili v družbi Video pro.



Jože Šušmelj Foto: Leo Caharija

NOVA GORICA > "V letošnjem letu smo se v podjetju Video pro odločili, da bomo naredili več dokumentarnih portretov ljudi, ki so zaznamovali čezmejni prostor. Med njimi je zagotovo tudi Jože Šušmelj, ki je lani praznoval osemdeset let," je za STA povedala predstavnica podjetja Erika Škrlep. Doslej so posneli že več dokumentarnih portretov v sodelovanju s slovenskim programom italijanske radiotelevizije RAI v Trstu.
V dokumentarnem filmu prikazujejo življenjsko in poklicno pot diplomata, snemali so ga v poletnih mesecih v številnih krajih na Primorskem, v zamejstvu in Ljubljani. Poleg pripovedovanja samega Šušmelja o svojem življenju in delu so film popestrili še s krajšimi pogovori o njem z različnimi znanimi Slovenci.
Film so prikazali danes v Novi Gorici, kasneje pa ga bodo predvajali na slovenskem programu RAI za Furlanijo-Julijsko krajino in tudi na Televiziji Koper. Današnjemu predvajanju je sledil pogovor s Šušmeljem, zgodovinarjem Brankom Marušičem in arhitektom Tomažem Vugo o razvoju novogoriške občine med letoma 1970 in 1980.
Šušmelj je bil med letoma 1972 in 1982 predsednik skupščine občine Nova Gorica, nato podpredsednik slovenske skupščine in vodja delegatov iz Slovenije v zveznem zboru tedanje Socialistične federativne republike Jugoslavije. Kot jugoslovanski in slovenski generalni konzul je devet let preživel v Trstu, štiri leta pa tudi kot minister svetnik na slovenskem veleposlaništvu v Rimu.
Tudi po upokojitvi leta 2003 ne miruje, saj opravlja številne funkcije, med drugimi je član območnega združenja Zveze borcev za vrednote NOB Slovenije - Nova Gorica in predsedstva ZZB za vrednote NOB Slovenije, v katerem opravlja tudi funkcijo predsednika komisije za mednarodne odnose. Je soustanovitelj Društva za mednarodne odnose in Kluba nekdanjih slovenskih veleposlanikov ter prejemnik številnih priznanj in odlikovanj.
Znan je tudi kot pisec več knjig.

A documentary portrait of Joze Sushmel premiered in Nova Gorica
04 Nov 2019, 17:50 by STA

A documentary film portrait about Joze Sushmel was presented today in Nova Gorica. A sociologist, politician and diplomat-born sociologist, politician and diplomat in Voglar, he performed many important tasks in his rich career, both for the Slovene as well as abroad, and left an indelible mark on it. The documentary was produced by Video pro.



Joze Susmelj Photo: Leo Cahari

NOVA GORICA> "This year we decided at Video Pro to make more documentary portraits of people who marked the cross-border area. Joze Susmelj, who celebrated his eighties last year, is definitely among them," a spokeswoman told STA. by Erika Škrlep. So far, several documentary portraits have been made in cooperation with the Slovenian program of the Italian radio and television RAI in Trieste.
The documentary shows the life and career of a diplomat, and was filmed in many places in the Primorska, neighboring countries and Ljubljana in the summer months. In addition to telling Šušmelj himself about his life and work, the film was further enhanced by brief discussions about it with various well-known Slovenes.
The film was shown today in Nova Gorica, and later it will be broadcast on the Slovenian program RAI for Friuli-Venezia Giulia and also on Television Koper. Today's broadcast was followed by an interview with Šušmelj, historian Branko Marušič and architect Tomaž Vugo about the development of the Nova Gorica municipality between 1970 and 1980.
From 1972 to 1982, Šušmelj was president of the Nova Gorica Municipal Assembly, then vice-president of the Slovenian Assembly and head of delegates from Slovenia in the Federal Assembly of the then Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia. As a Yugoslav and Slovenian consul general, he spent nine years in Trieste, and four years as a minister councilor at the Slovenian Embassy in Rome.
He has not been dormant since retiring in 2003, as he performs many functions, including being a member of the regional association of fighters for the values of the National Liberation War of Slovenia - Nova Gorica and the Presidency of the ZZB for the values of the National Liberation War of Slovenia. He is the co-founder of the Association for International Relations and the Club of Former Slovenian Ambassadors and the recipient of numerous awards and honors.
He is also known as the writer of several books.
